PUP.TotalAV.desc:
PUP.TotalAV is a fake antivirus program which is normally downloaded and installed as an independant file (not a bundle).
This program will ask for personal data and request payment.
This program can be removed by the Unwanted Program Removal tool, or by Malwarebytes's ADWCleaner (https://malwarebytes.com/adwcleaner)

PUP.MediaGet.desc:
PUP.MediaGet is a unwanted program which can be downloaded and installed as an independant file, but most of the time is installed as part of a bundled install.
For more information, please see https://malwaretips.com/blogs/pup-adware-mediaget-removal/. 
This threat is detected and removed by the Unwanted Program Removal tool. 
The threat is detected by Malwarebytes as PUP.Optional.MediaGet, Microsoft as PUA:Win32/MediaGet, and Kaspersky as Not-a-virus:HEUR:Downloader.Win32.MegiaGet.gen., and can be removed using ADWCleaner or Hitman Pro.
VirusTotal scan: https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/af7b36c0f9f48f35315877e3cd5efb83c1a122a043ea9228db7da9c1c3c3120b/detection

JokeProgram.TPSChallo.desc:
JokeProgram.TPSChallo is a joke program created by The PC Security Channel (see https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TtKlue9t2JU).
This program has two options - 'trick' and 'treat'. 
Clicking 'trick' will cause the program to lock the screen, while 'treat' will subscribe you to the creator's YouTube channel.
The screenlocker does not presist reboot. To escape, just reboot your computer.
This program is detected by most antiviruses - see https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/887ba691653fc5a6a91ea58a5993d0e999a4efc285dc10e21bca2bf0de7fe029?

Trojan.Linux.generic.2.desc:
Trojan.Linux.generic.2 is a malicious program targetted at Linux systems.
This threat was primarily spread through a compromised NPM package.
This program may preform cryptomining, but due to the nature of how it was propagated, it has been classified as a trojan.
For more information, see https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/28d5f75e289d652061c754079b23ec372da2e8feb1066a3d57381163b614c06c/detection and https://github.com/conventional-changelog/conventional-changelog/issues/282.
